text:
Turon is a city in Reno County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 387 people lived there.
History.
Turon was created in 1886. It was incorporated as a city in 1905.
In 1887, the Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway built a main line from Herington through Turon to Pratt.
Geography.
Turon is at (37.807415, -98.427061). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Turon has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Turon has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 387 people, 159 households, and 98 families living in Turon.
